column2: CALIFORNIA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You want to make a right turn at the corner. A pedestrian with a guide dog is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you. Before making your right turn, you should:
column4: wait until the person crosses the street.
column6: turn off your engine until the person crosses the street.
column8: tell the pedestrian when to cross the street.

column2: 2. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: look for a detour or another route.
column6: make a U-turn.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

column2: 3. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 4. Driving along the right-rear side of another vehicle is:
column4: dangerous because you’re probably in one of the driver’s blind spots.
column6: a good way to maintain a space cushion on your left side.
column8: a good defensive driving technique to avoid drivers’ blind spots.

column2: 5. Flash your brake lights or turn on your emergency flashers if you:
column4: are backing out of a parking space.
column6: are temporarily parked in a traffic lane to make a delivery.
column8: need to warn other drivers of a collision ahead.

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column6: a reduction of lanes.
column8: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 7. You are on a two-way road and the vehicle ahead of you is turning left into a driveway. You may legally pass the vehicle on the right:
column4: if there’s enough road between the curb and the vehicle.
column6: even if you must cross a solid white line painted on the road.
column8: even if you must drive in a bicycle lane to do so.

column2: 8. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column6: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column8: increase your speed immediately.

column2: 9. The yield sign means:
column4: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column6: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.

column2: 10. You should allow a four-second or more cushion when:
column4: The driver behind you wants to pass.
column6: Being crowded by a tailgater.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 11. Which of these statements is true about changing lanes:
column4: Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.
column6: Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blinds.
column8: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

column2: 12. Driving slower than the traffic flow tends to:
column4: make a collision less likely to happen.
column6: make a collision more likely to happen.
column8: not change the chances of having a collision.

column2: 13. You should increase the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead when you:
column4: are being tailgated by another driver.
column6: drive slower than the posted speed limit.
column8: follow a small passenger vehicle.

column2: 14. To turn left from a one-way street with multiple lanes onto a two-way street, start the turn in:
column4: any lane.
column6: the lane closest to the right curb.
column8: the far left lane.

column2: 15. Two sets of solid double yellow lines spaced 2 feet or more apart:
column4: may be used to begin or end left-hand turns.
column6: mark traffic lanes going in the same direction.
column8: are considered a barrier.

column2: 16. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Maintain the correct speed.
column6: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 17. When approaching a crosswalk where a blind pedestrian is waiting to cross, you must stop:
column4: at the crosswalk and wait for the pedestrian to cross the street.
column6: more than five feet from the crosswalk so the pedestrian will not be distracted by the sound of the engine.
column8: at the crosswalk and then tell the pedestrian when to cross the street.

column2: 18. If you are towing another vehicle or trailer on a freeway with four lanes in your direction, you may travel in:
column4: the far right lane only.
column6: any of the traffic lanes in your direction.
column8: either of the two right lanes.

column2: 19. When is it legal to use a cellphone without a hands-free device while driving?
column4: Never.
column6: When making a call while stopped at a red light.
column8: When making a call for emergency assistance.

column2: 20. Which of these is a legal U-turn:
column4: on a divided highway where there is a paved opening for a turn.
column6: over two sets of double yellow lines in the roadway.
column8: 150 feet away from a hill or curve.

column2: 21. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: NO TURN ON RED.

column2: 22. Unless otherwise posted, school zone speed limits are ___ or under.
column4: 25 MPH
column6: 35 MPH
column8: 15 MPH

column2: 23. A flashing yellow traffic signal at an intersection means:
column4: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column6: Stop. Yield to all cross traffic before crossing the intersection.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 24. This white sign means drivers:
column4: must wait for the solid green light before they turn left.
column6: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column8: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.

column2: 25. You should use your brakes to slow your vehicle on a sharp curve:
column4: as you drive through a curve.
column6: right after entering the curve.
column8: before you enter the curve.

column2: 26. This sign indicates:
column4: A no-passing zone
column6: Yield
column8: A slow-moving vehicle

column2: 27. Your driving lane is next to a bicycle lane. You want to make a right turn at the upcoming intersection. You:
column4: may not enter the bicycle lane to make your turn.
column6: should only merge into the bicycle lane if you stop before turning.
column8: must merge into the bicycle lane before making your turn.

column2: 28. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: what is not allowed.
column6: the direction they should travel.
column8: the law.

column2: 29. This sign means:
column4: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column6: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.

column2: 30. If you are involved in a collision, you must exchange with the person(s) involved your driver license information and:
column4: proof of insurance, vehicle registration, and current address.
column6: proof of insurance and current address only.
column8: vehicle registration only.

column2: 31. This sign means:
column4: No passing zone ahead.
column6: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
column8: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

column2: 32. Orange-colored road signs warn you of:
column4: a school zone ahead.
column6: road workers or road equipment ahead.
column8: a traffic signal ahead.

column2: 33. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column4: at most intersections.
column6: in school zones.
column8: on multiple lane highways.

column2: 34. To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:
column4: Any lane, as long as it is safe.
column6: The lane in the center of the road.
column8: The lane closest to the left curb

column2: 35. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column6: they cannot go straight ahead.
column8: a divided highway is ahead.

column2: 36. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: Do not turn right.
